[cache] Add Cache class

further recovery. Items are stored in order in `dirname` directory
path. Items are also retrieved following the same storage order.

data.Author: Santiago Dueñas <sduenas@bitergia.com>
data.message:
[bugzilla] Fix infinite loop error while fetching a bug list

Some Bugzilla servers do not allow to request a bug list using
timestamps that include a 'T' character between date and time
values (i.e '2016-02-02T06:00:00). These servers ignore the
time values, so it might cause to stuck in a infinite loop
while fetching a bug list.

Removing 'T' character by a whitespace fix the problem.

data.Author: Santiago Dueñas <sduenas@bitergia.com>
data.message:
[mbox] Ignore messages without 'Message-ID' or 'Date' headers

These headers are mandatory in any message, so those messages
without them are ignored.

In fact, the 'mbox' class from the 'mailbox' module produces
invalid messages when a line on a message body starts with
a 'From ' string. In those cases, an invalid message is generated
using the remaining part of the body. Checking if the message
has some headers (like 'Message-ID' or 'Date') avoids the problem,
ignoring them.

data.Author: Santiago Dueñas <sduenas@bitergia.com>
data.message:
[mbox] Avoid case sensitive checks on headers using case-insensitive dict

As the headers of the messages can follow different case sensitive
patterns (i.e Message-ID, Message-id, Message-Id), we use
'CaseInsensitiveDict' from 'requests' package to store the contents
of a message and to avoid multiple existence checks of the same
header.

data.Author: Santiago Dueñas <sduenas@bitergia.com>
data.message:
[jira] Use millisecs to search for issues that were last updated on

JQL API allows to search for issues using dates as milliseconds
since 1970-01-01. Take into account that Unix time is calculated
in seconds, thus a conversion to milliseconds is needed before
this value is used.

data.Author: Santiago Dueñas <sduenas@bitergia.com>
data.message:
[backend] Change item structure

Items generated using the metadata decorator will change their
structure with this patch.

Metadata is no longer stored under '__metadata__' key. Instead
of this, metadata will be stored at the top level of the item
while the contents of the item will be stored under 'data' keyword.

This is an example of the new item structure:

  {
   'backend_version' : '0.1',
   'backend_name' : 'mock backend',
   'perceval_version' : '0.0.1',
   'timestamp' : 1459334803.0,
   'origin' : 'example.com',
   'uuid' : '0caaf24ab1a0c33440c06afe99df986365b0781f',
   'updated_on' : 1459334803.0,
   'data' : {
             'id' : 8,
             'title' : 'Mock item',
             'description' : 'A short description of this item'
            }
  }

Specific unit tests for each backen were also updated.

Function datetime.datetime.fromtimestamp() creates a
new datetime object from an epoch value but using
the timezone of the system. Replacing this function
by datetime.datetime.utcfromtimestamp() returns
a datetime with UTC timezone.

data.Author: Santiago Dueñas <sduenas@bitergia.com>
data.message:
[github] Fix error using utcnow() and timestamp() in chain

When timestamp() method is called, it applies the timezone
of the system where it is called. If utcnow() is called
before, the result date will not be in UTC, it will be in the
timezone added by timestamp().

To fix this problem, use time.time() that does the same
that calling to datetime.datetime.utcnow().timestamp() .

found. This patch fix that problem. Unit tests were also added.

data.message:
[stackexchange] Sleep the client when 'backoff' field is received

According to StackExchange documentation, "a dynamic throttle
is also in place on a per-method level. If an application
receives a response with the backoff field set, it must wait
that many seconds before hitting the same method again."

This patch makes the client to wait the seconds set on 'backoff'
field before sending a new requests.

data.Author: Santiago Dueñas <sduenas@bitergia.com>
data.message:
[tests] Fix invalid mock server config in stackexchange test

On 'test_get_questions_more()' test, the httpretty configuration
for the mock HTTP server was wrong. It worked because httpretty
push the bodies that will be returned to a queue, but the coded
behaviour was wrong. This patch fixes that problem.

The test has been renamed to 'test_get_questions_pagination'.

[supybot] Ignore empty comment lines

have the pattern "2016-07-19T01:02:03  <nick>". This commit

parsing exception.

data.Author: Santiago Dueñas <sduenas@bitergia.com>
data.message:
[mediawiki] Add test flag to ignore MAX_RECENT_DAYS exception

On Mediawiki pre-1.27 servers, due to server restrictions,
'from_date' parameter only works for dates not older than
MAX_RECENT_DAYS. Usually, this parameter is configured to
30 days. Due to this, unit tests started to fail when the
date that was set was 30 days than the current date.

To fix this problem, a flag has been added to the backend to
ignore this date check.

[phabricator] Fix 'constraints' param type on maniphest.search

Some older versions of Phabricator expect a list type of dicts
on 'constraints' parameter when maniphest.search method is
called. Newer versions work either with lists or dictionaries.
This patch fixes that problem.

data.Author: Alberto Martín <alberto.martin@bitergia.com>
data.message:
[mediawiki] Use ISO 8601 supported format

The output generated by datetime.isoformat() method is not
supported by Mediawiki API (>= 1.27). It makes the program
to crash when a request is sent. See http://meta.wikitolearn.org/api.php
and https://phabricator.wikimedia.org/T144482 for more info.

This patch generates a supported datetime string with the format
YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ssZ (i.e 2001-01-15T14:56:00Z).

Unit tests were also updated to check this case.

Fixes #54

data.Author: Santiago Dueñas <sduenas@bitergia.com>
data.message:
[phabricator] Fetch data about authors that are not users

Actores such as bots, scheduled tasks, etc, can be found as
authors (normally in transactions) in Phabricator tasks.
Using the 'users' API methods to get their data returns an empty
result and made chashing the code. To fetch these data, it is
needed to use to 'phids' API method.

Backend version incresed to '0.1.1'.

data.Author: Santiago Dueñas <sduenas@bitergia.com>
data.message:
[pipermail] Fix error storing decompressed mbox files

By default, requests library decompresses gzip-encoded
responses, but in some cases is only able to decompress
some parts due to encoding issues or to mixed contents.

This patch fixes this problem storing the orinal/raw data
(compressed or decompressed) into the mbox file to process
it in the next phase using the decoder of the MBox class.

Backend version bumped to '0.4.1'.

data.Author: Jesus M. Gonzalez-Barahona <jgb@gsyc.es>
data.message:
Add MANIFEST.in to avoid problems when building sdist package

Whe building an sdist package, and pandoc was not available,
the rst version of README.md cannot be created. In this case,
README.md should be added to the package, but it was not.

Closes #68

data.Author: Santiago Dueñas <sduenas@bitergia.com>
data.message:
[jira] Fix error fetching items in random order

So far, items were fetching without an specific order. This made
resuming impossible. This patch fixes this problem, fetching
items ordered by the time they were updated in ascending order
(oldest first).

Backend version bumped to '0.6.1'.

Fixes #89

data.Author: Santiago Dueñas <sduenas@bitergia.com>
data.message:
[redmine] Fetch users data

This commit makes the backend to fetch data about users
and include it within the item. User's data contain names,
email addresses and other useful information. These data
are fetched for authors, assignees and journals authors.

Backend version increased to 0.5.0.

data.Author: Santiago Dueñas <sduenas@bitergia.com>
data.message: Merge branch 'redmine-users' of 'https://github.com/grimoirelab/perceval.git'

data.Author: Santiago Dueñas <sduenas@bitergia.com>
data.message:
[supybot] Parse messages written by special bots

Some bots write to the IRC logs starting and ending with a '-'.
This patch parses those entries generating new items of type
'comment'.

data.Author: Santiago Dueñas <sduenas@bitergia.com>
data.message:
[redmine] Fix HTTP 404 error fetching users

The access to some users could return a HTTP 404 error.
This commit fixes this issue, skipping these users and
completing their information with an empty dictionary.

Backend version updated to 0.5.1.

data.Author: Santiago Dueñas <sduenas@bitergia.com>
data.message:
[backend] Fix bad UTC timestamp generation on metadata field

The field 'timestamp' on metadata was not generated in UTC.
The call to 'datetime.now()' does not generate a timestamp
in UTC. It does using the timezone of the system. The right
way is to call to 'datetime.utcnow()' method.

Fixes #92

data.Author: Santiago Dueñas <sduenas@bitergia.com>
data.message:
[tests] Make sure tests import the right backend classes

Since the introduction of the namespace for backends, tests
first try to import the packages installed in the system
by setuptools, ignoring the classes from this repository.

This hack fixes the problem updating the sys.path and
declaring the 'perceval.backends'. This declaration will
make packages to point to development packages insted
of those installed in the system.

data.Author: Santiago Dueñas <sduenas@bitergia.com>
data.message:
[askbot] Fix 'data-comment-id' attribute error

Later versions of askbot do not include this attribute
within the comment information. This attribute was replaced
by 'data-post-id'.

This patch fixes this error providing compatibility with
older askbot versions.

Fixes #95

data.Author: Santiago Dueñas <sduenas@bitergia.com>
data.message:
[askbot] Fix error finding question <div>

Askbot versions use different class attributes to tag the <div>
elements related to questions. This patch fixes this problem
searching among the possible question <div> elements.

Version updated to 0.1.1.

data.Author: Santiago Dueñas <sduenas@bitergia.com>
data.message:
[meetup] Fix error generating multivalued URL parameters

Metup API does not support parameter list values with the format
'?param=value1&param=value2'. The API only works with
'?param=value1,value2' parameters. This caused that some data
were not fetched right. This commit fixes this error.

Backend version bumped to 0.2.0.

data.message:
[askbot] Fetch full list of comments

Before, by parsing the HTML we were unable to retrieve the full list of
comments inside each element. Now we do a different request to fetch the
comments by a given object_id. The content displayed in the item will be
exactly the same as the returned one.

Backend version updated to 0.2.0

data.Author: Santiago Dueñas <sduenas@bitergia.com>
data.message:
[bugzilla] Set maximum number of bugs requested on CSV queries

The 'buglist' method fetches a CSV stream  that contains a
summary of bugs. By default, it fetches 10000 bugs but in
some busy servers the request lasts enough to be disconnected
before fetching the list.

A new parameter 'max_bugs_csv' has been defined to avoid these
problems limiting the number of bugs requested on each CVS
query.

Backend version updated to '0.6.0'.
This mission of this task is to include a parameter to limit the number of bugs download on each call.

data.Author: Santiago Dueñas <sduenas@bitergia.com>
data.message:
[supybot] Parse user actions with the format "*nick msg"

The current pattern for parsing action comments expected
entries like "* nick msg* but there are some cases where
the entries are like "*nick msg". This commit parses those
entries too.

Backend version updated to 0.4.2.

data.Author: Santiago Dueñas <sduenas@bitergia.com>
data.message:
[supybot] Parse action and bot empty lines

This patch adds support for parsing some types of empty lines
that might be found in actions and bots messages.

Backend version updated to '0.4.3'.

data.Author: Santiago Dueñas <sduenas@bitergia.com>
data.message:
[backend] Define cache property

The backend defines a new property named 'cache'. It allows to
access the cache object of a backend. A setter is also defined
for this property, so different cache objects can be used
after the initialization of the object.

Backend version updated to '0.5'

data.Author: Santiago Dueñas <sduenas@bitergia.com>
data.message:
[backend] Add class to manage and parse command arguments

The BackendCommandArgumentParser class allows to define,
manage and parse those arguments needed to run a command.
Arguments related to caching or authentication can be set
using this class.

data.Author: Santiago Dueñas <sduenas@bitergia.com>
data.message:
[cache] Add function to initialize a cache storage

The function 'setup_cache' provides a handler to create
cache objects for accessing the cache storage and do typical
tasks, such as backups, during its initialization.

data.Author: Santiago Dueñas <sduenas@bitergia.com>
data.message: [backend] Define generic run method for BackendCommand class

data.Author: Santiago Dueñas <sduenas@bitergia.com>
data.message: [utils] Add functions to check the parameters of a callable object

data.Author: Santiago Dueñas <sduenas@bitergia.com>
data.message:
[backend] Generalize BackendCommand to run any type of backend

The usage of introspection on __init__ and run() methods, allows
to have a generic command class that can run any type of backend.
Thus, minimal BackendCommand subclasses implementation will be
needed to support the distinct kind of backends Perceval can
execute.

data.Author: Santiago Dueñas <sduenas@bitergia.com>
data.message:
[backend] Run pre/post methods during command initialization

These two methods will be called before the initialization of
the backend (pre_init) and after its initialization (post_init).
These methods were intentionally left empty and would be
overriden in case it is necessary.

data.Author: Santiago Dueñas <sduenas@bitergia.com>
data.message:
[backend] Add '--to-date' argument to BackendCommandArgumentParser

This argument will make backends possible to fetch items before
a given date. Used together with '--from-date' will make possible
to fetch items within a date range.

data.Author: Santiago Dueñas <sduenas@bitergia.com>
data.message:
[meetup] Add 'to-date' parameter to fetch()

This parameter allows to fetch items updated before a given date.
Combined with 'from-date' allows to fetch items within a date
range.

Backend version increased to 0.4.0.

data.Author: Santiago Dueñas <sduenas@bitergia.com>
data.message: [tests] Add missed test file for meetup unit tests

data.Author: Santiago Dueñas <sduenas@bitergia.com>
data.message:
[supybot] Generate item ids using the body of the message

Two or more IRC messages can be sent by the same user at the same
time. As the identifier of an item is generated using the date
and the nick of the sender, it causes that two different messages
could have the same identifier.

This commit fixes this bug using the body of the message to
generate the identifier of each item.

Backend version bumped to 0.5.0.

data.Author: Santiago Dueñas <sduenas@bitergia.com>
data.message:
[jenkins] Ignore invalid job builds

Some requests to get the builds of a job can fail because
the server cannot generate the response for several reasons.
Usually, the server returns 500 HTTP errors or sends invalid
JSON responses.

The backend will check this errors, ignoring them when is
possible.

Backend version updated to 0.5.1

data.Author: Santiago Dueñas <sduenas@bitergia.com>
data.message:
[jenkins] Fix compatibility error with Python 3.4

JSONDecodeError exception is only available from Python 3.5
and so forth. This exception is a subclass of ValueError.
Catching that exception will make it work with Python 3.4
and newer versions.

Version updated to 0.5.2.

data.Author: Santiago Dueñas <sduenas@bitergia.com>
data.message: [git] Define exception for empty repositories

data.Author: Santiago Dueñas <sduenas@bitergia.com>
data.message:
[git] Fix error fetching items from an empty repository

On empty repositories, those which do not have any history or
are only initialized, there are some commands that cannot
be run, like a pull or log. If any of this commands is called
an error will be returned. Thus, fetch() method fails when
a repository is empty.

This commit fixes this problem, generating an empty iterator
for those calls on an empty repository.

Backend version bumped to '0.6.1'.

Fixes #102

data.Author: Santiago Dueñas <sduenas@bitergia.com>
data.message: Merge branch 'git-empty' of 'https://github.com/grimoirelab/perceval.git'

data.Author: Santiago Dueñas <sduenas@bitergia.com>
data.message:
[git] Parse Git commit trailers

Git commit messages can contain some tags, called 'trailers',
which their meaning is project dependent. Most common one
is 'Signed-off-by' added when 'git commit --signoff' is
executed. These trailers have the same format of the headers
of a commit.

This patch parses those core trailers. So far, only 'Signed-off-by'
is available.

Backend version increased to '0.7.0'.

data.Author: Santiago Dueñas <sduenas@bitergia.com>
data.message:
[git] Fix error counting objects on non-empty repositories

Git client's count_objects() method only counted the number of
unpacked objects. This caused to consider like empty repositories
those which all of their objects were packed.

Using the option '-v' when 'git count-objects' command is run
gives the number of packed repositories too.

Backend version increased to 0.7.1.

Fixes #107

During the parsing phase, each message is validated checking
the contents of some of the headers. Those messages which
their 'Date' headers contain an invalid date will be

data.message:
[phabricator] Fix error fetching data from non-existent users

When a user does not exists on Phabricator, the API does not
returns an error. It returns an empty list. The case where an
empty list is returned was not managed by the parser, raising
an exception. This patch fixes that bug.

data.Author: Santiago Dueñas <sduenas@bitergia.com>
data.message:
[mbox] Fix decoding error on unix-from headers

The mbox class from Python's mailbox module fails when it tries
to decode non-ascii unix-from headers. This header is used as
a separator between messages. When this error is found, the
class stops reading messages from the mbox.

To fix this bug it was necessary to wrap mbox class to override
the way messages are readed from the mbox file, caching the
exception and decoding using UTF-8.

Backend version increased to 0.7.2.

data.message:
[gerrit] Use 'number' instead of 'id' as the identifier of a review

The identifier of the change, Change-Id (or id), is not unique.
What it is unique in a gerrit sever is the number of each change
and review.

data.message:

When repositories are reset to the current status on upstream,
some of them cannot deal with 'origin' reference because
it is ambiguous. Replacing it by FETCH_HEAD works on those
repositories with defined branches on the origin.

Repositories in detached state do not need to be reset after
'git fetch' is called. This patch makes the code to skips the
hard reset for this repositories.

Fixes #105

regarding the usage of whitespaces and blank lines.
PEP8 was used as reference. This is the full list:

  * E203 whitespace before <char>
  * E222 multiple spaces after operator
  * E225 missing whitespace around operator
  * E226 missing whitespace around arithmetic operator
  * E261 at least two spaces before inline comment
  * E265 block comment should start with '# '
  * E302 expected 2 blank lines
  * E303 too many blank lines
  * W291 trailing whitespace

  * E127 continuation line over-indented for visual indent
  * E128 continuation line under-indented for visual indent
  * E131 continuation line unaligned for hanging indent

data.Author: Valerio Cosentino <valcos@bitergia.com>
data.message:
[git] Redefine default storing repositories path

The default schema followed to store repositories fails when
a repository contains modules and these modules are retrieved
with next calls to Perceval command. With this commit, Git
paths are modified by adding '-git' at the end.

For instance, given two repos A and B (with B being a submodule of A):

A - https://gerrit.wikimedia.org/r/mediawiki/extensions
B - https://gerrit.wikimedia.org/r/mediawiki/extensions/AbsenteeLandlord

This fix will clone the repositories:

A under .perceval/repositories/https://gerrit.wikimedia.org/r/mediawiki/extensions-git
B under .pervecal/repositories/https://gerrit.wikimedia.org/r/mediawiki/extensions/AbsenteeLandlord-git

A will contain an empty directory for the submodule 'AbsenteeLandlord'
B will contain the git repository of 'AbsenteeLandlord'

data.Author: Santiago Dueñas <sduenas@bitergia.com>
data.message:
[git] Work with bared repositories only

To work with repositories, Perceval always keeps synced
copies of them in local directories (usually under
$HOME/.perceval/repositories). So far, these repositories
were cloned as working repositories. Anyone was able to
modify them; i.e: adding or removing files.

With this patch, Git backend will only work with bared
repositories. This makes easier the synchronization with
the origin and avoids problems with local modifications.

The clone() method will run 'clone' command using the
option '--mirror'.

pull() method is no longer supported and has been replaced
by update(), which runs 'remote update' command to keep
the repository in sync. Prior to this, it was necessary
to run several commands like 'fetch' or 'reset' to have
a similar status like the origin one.

Backend version increased to 0.8.2.

data.Author: Santiago Dueñas <sduenas@bitergia.com>
data.message:
Merge branch 'git-mirror' of 'https://github.com/sduenas/perceval'

Merges #196
Closes #196

data.Author: Santiago Dueñas <sduenas@bitergia.com>
data.message:
[git] Fix fetch-pack for HTTPs connections

The command 'fetch-pack' only works with the TCP (git://)
protocol unless '--stateless-rpc' flag is active, the caller
has established a connection with the server using HTTP
and a pipe to it.

Some Git servers do not let to talk to them using TCP
protocol, only using HTTP(s) on top of it.

To fix this issue, dulwich library has been used. It allows
to talk to Git repositories without calling git commands
directly. In this particular case, it is able to fetch
packs using any protocol.

This would be the first step to replace Git commands by
calls to a pure Python library.

data.message:
[git] Change 'mirror' to 'bare' repositories

Mirrors can contain references and objects that are not part
of the real activity in the repositories. For instance, GitHub
repos have references to all the pull requests submitted (merged
or not).

This patch fixes that problem, cloning and updating repositories
in that way.

data.Author: Santiago Dueñas <sduenas@bitergia.com>
data.message:
[git] Limit the number of 'have' commits sent by fetch-pack

The current code sends, during the fetch-pack negotiation,
the hash for all the commits that the client has. This is not
needed. Only head hashes are usually needed by the server
to determine which objects needs to send back to the client.
In big repositories, this may hang the communication.

This commits adds a simple graph walker which only sends
the current hashes for each 'refs/heads/' or 'refs/tags/'
available in the client repository.

Backend version updated to 0.8.5.

When an instance tryed to connect to a Git host, the code raised
a "Name of service not known" error.

To fix this bug, we delegate to dulwich the initialization
of clients according to the protocol that will be used.

data.Author: Santiago Dueñas <sduenas@bitergia.com>
data.message:
[backend] Fix 'find_backends' to get all backend descendants

This function uses the class method `__subclasses__` to get
derived classes from Backend and BackendCommand. The problem
with this method is it only returns direct/children subclasses,
not grandchildren classes.

MBox is a children of Backend class while Pipermail and Hyperkitty
are children of MBox and grandchildren of Backend. So far, only
MBox was found because it's a direct subclass of Backend.

data.message:
[git] Ignore error codes when executing a command

Some error codes can be ignored when a Git command is executed
using the parameter 'ignored_error_codes'. Zero code will

data.Author: Santiago Dueñas <sduenas@bitergia.com>
data.message:
[git] Fix error discovering refs in repos which don't have any

Commands to discover references return an error exit code
when no references are found. This caused the sync() method
to fail. This patch fixes this problem ignoring those
errors considered as valid.

Backend version increased to 0.8.8.

data.Author: Santiago Dueñas <sduenas@bitergia.com>
data.message:
[git] Request in fetch-pack the outdated refs only

The current code, during the fetch-pack negotiation, sent the
hashes of all the references published by the server. This is
not needed as the client only needs the outdated references
to keep the repository in sync.

This commit reduces the number of 'want' references, sending
the outdated ones only.

Backend version updated to 0.8.9.

data.Author: Santiago Dueñas <sduenas@bitergia.com>
data.message:
[meetup] Remove 'draft' status due to a bug in Meetup API

This is a work around to fix the problem with Meetup API.
In some cases, having this status in the list of requested
events, makes the API to return zero events.

The bug was reported in https://github.com/meetup/api/issues/260.
As soon as it gets fixed, we will add it back again to the list
of requested events.

Backend version updated to 0.7.0.

data.Author: Valerio Cosentino <valcos@bitergia.com>
data.message:
[git] Fix cloned directory of local repository

This patch fixes the issue #262. The git_path is derived by
joining the default Perceval location plus the path of the local
Git repository to analyse, stripped of the initial slash. The
initial slash in a component of a os.path.join causes all
previous components to be thrown away and the joining
continues from the absolute path component.

data.message:

the remote repository already has. These references are not
needed by the remote repository to send the set of new commits.
Thus, the number of references sent to the server are reduced.

Backend version updated to 0.8.10.

data.Author: Israel Herraiz <israel.herraiz@bbvadata.com>
data.message:
[git] Parse additional pattern for moved files

There was a pattern for moved files in Git that was not captured
by Perceval. When the destination directory and filename are both
different, the pattern in the stats part of the Git log is like
the following:

    dir1/file1.txt => dir2/file2.txt

In the files dictionary, Perceval created three items (instead of
two). The additional file had "dir1/file1.txt => dir2/file2.txt"
as name.

This patch fixes this problem, by adding an additional pattern
for moved files to the stats parsing.

data.Author: Valerio Cosentino <valcos@bitergia.com>
data.message:
[archive] Add Archive class

The data returned during fetch executions would be stored in
different archives (one per execution) for further recovering.
It will allow to transparently play back previous fetch executions,
enabling the recovery of the stored data as it was originally
collected from the repository.

This new system will replace the current cache system, which its
functionality is similar to the archive.

[stackexchange] Apply archive to Stackexchange backend

This code allows the Stackexchange backend to store fetched data to
archives. Thus it allows to transparently play back previous fetch
executions, enabling the recovery of the stored data as it was
originally collected from the data source.

data.Author: Jesus M. Gonzalez-Barahona <jgb@gsyc.es>
data.message:
[pipermail, bugzilla] Avoid warning by BeautifulSoup.

When running before this patch, the hypermail and bugzilla backends
produce this warning:

--------------------
/usr/local/lib/python3.5/dist-packages/bs4/__init__.py:181: UserWarning: No parser was explicitly specified,
so I'm using the best available HTML parser for this system ("html.parser").
This usually isn't a problem, but if you run this code on another system,
or in a different virtual environment, it may use a different parser and
behave differently.

The code that caused this warning is on line 882 of the file /usr/lib/python3.5/threading.py.
To get rid of this warning, change code that looks like this:

 BeautifulSoup(YOUR_MARKUP})

to this:

 BeautifulSoup(YOUR_MARKUP, "html.parser")

  markup_type=markup_type))
---------------------

This patch just does that.

data.Author: Miguel Ángel Fernández <mafesan@bitergia.com>
data.message:
Add support to run tests using setup.py file

To run user-defined commands using setup.py it is necessary
to add Command derivated classes. In this case, TestCommand
class was included to run tests.

data.Author: Miguel Ángel Fernández <mafesan@bitergia.com>
data.message:
Fix tests to support their execution in two different modes

By default, Python gets tests from its `PYTHONPATH`.
The line which was removed now in each test forced to get tests
from the source code directory for developing purposes.

Now all tests can be executed in two different ways:
 - Using `setup.py` script with `test` command.
 - Using `run_tests.py` script from `tests` directory.

data.Author: Miguel Ángel Fernández <mafesan@bitergia.com>
data.message:
Add tests requirements pip-file

This file is also included in the `.travis.yml` file in the same
way as `requirements.txt` file.

data.Author: Santiago Dueñas <sduenas@bitergia.com>
data.message:
[mbox] Define 'tmp_path' variable before copying mboxes

This variable is not created when an error occurs copying mboxes.
It makes the code fail because the finally block that handles
OSError exceptions requires that variable.

Aditionally, this commit improves the test where this copything
mboxes functionality is tested. So far, the test would fail when
super users run it.

Backend version updated to 0.9.1

data.Author: Santiago Dueñas <sduenas@bitergia.com>
data.message:
Update coverage call to remove 'omit' parameter

Recent changes made that tests are run (by default) using
the installed egg package. In Travis CI, coverage script
was called omitting eggs packages. This produced an empty
coverage report.

This commit removes the omit parameter to analyze files inside
the egg package.

the timestamp when the fetch is executed) to the archive args,
thus allowing the correct retrieval of archived data.

data.message:
[askbot] Replace user_info for wiki post

This patch replaces the string representing the user_info
for wiki posts with a dict. This new format is aligned with
the other user_info format, thus it avoids failures with ES
mappings.

data.Author: Valerio Cosentino <valcos@bitergia.com>
data.message:
[mediawiki] Force sort request payload parameters

This patch sorts payload parameters used for api remote requests
to allow the correct retrieval of archived data. Furthermore,
it includes in the fetched args stored in the archive also the
value of the _test_mode variable. Thus, simplifying the generation
of archives for testing purposes.

data.Author: Valerio Cosentino <valcos@bitergia.com>
data.message:
[tests] Modify tests when fetching from archive

This patch modifies the generic test used to check
the fetch_from_archive method. Now two different backend objects
are used, thus it ensures that backend and method
params are initialized in the same way independently from which method
is called (fetch or fetch_from_archive)

data.message:

from remote a data source and the other one from an archive)
in order to ensure that backend and method
params are initialized in the same way independently from which method
is called (fetch or fetch_from_archive)

data.Author: Alvaro del Castillo <acs@bitergia.com>
data.message: Update version number to 0.9.12

data.Author: Santiago Dueñas <sduenas@bitergia.com>
data.message:
[backend] Remove empty category from parsed arguments

The 'category' argument does not have a default value. When
parameters are parsed and a category is not given, its value
is set to 'None'. This caused an error due to backends
do not consider this value as a valid category.

This patch removes the category from the parsed parameters
when the value is empty or None.

data.message:
[pipermail] Handle inaccessible archive URLs

This patch enables the handling of inaccessible archive URLs.
Thus, a warning is logged when a 403 HTTP error is returned and
the archive is skipped.

data.message:
[pipermail] Increase test coverage

This code provides tests to increase the test coverage. In
particular, the tests check that:
(i) an error is thrown when an http error different from 403
is returned when downloading mail archives
(ii) the directory where to store the archives is created, if
it does not exist.

data.Author: Valerio Cosentino <valcos@bitergia.com>
data.message:
[github] Add  pull request data

This patch enables the GitHub backend to fetch pull request data.
Pull requests can be fetched setting in the fetch method the
category 'pull request'. The pull request data consists of:
- review comments
- requested reviewers
- reactions on review comments
- data about the user merging the pull request
- data about the user submitting the pull request.

data.message:
[client] Avoid negative sleep time error for rate limit reset

This patch prevents to sleep for a negative number of seconds when
waiting for tokens rate limit reset. The error seems to occur when
a given token is shared among several fetching processes.

data.Author: Valerio Cosentino <valcos@bitergia.com>
data.message:
[tests] Fix fetch_from_archive test

This patch fixes the method _test_fetch_from_archive. Before,
archived items and items were read from the same backend, now
archived items are read from backend_read_archive, while items

data.Author: Jesus M. Gonzalez-Barahona <jgb@gsyc.es>
data.message:
Fix support for package namespaces.

This module was not really using package namespaces. This
patch should provide that support. For that, some changes
had to be done to the module itself, mainly changing
__init__.py in perceval and perceval/backends to contain
only the line for declaring namepaces. This means that
symbols that were exported by those __init__.py files
now need to be imported from the corresponding modules.
In particular, __version__ is now provided by
perceval.backends.core for this package.

All of this has bin fixed in bin/perceval, but maybe
other packages (GrimoireELK, SirArthur, Mordred)
would need similar fixes.

[gitlab] Add merge_request category

This code enhances the GitLab backend to extract merge requests
data, which includes comments and reactions (emojis) on merge
requests, commits and changes. Note that, due to recent changes
on the GitLab API, the way of filtering issues and merge requests
has changed accordingly.

data.Author: Valerio Cosentino <valcos@bitergia.com>
data.message:
[groupsio] Fetch archives from group-specific domains

This code allows the groupsio backend to fetch archives of
organizations having their own domains (e.g., lists.cloudfoundry.org).
Given a group name and a token, the corresponding group id is
searched among the list of subscriptions of the token. If the
group id is not found, an error is thrown.

Groupsio test code has been changed accordingly.

data.Author: Valerio Cosentino <valcos@bitergia.com>
data.message:
[groupsio] Make api token a required param

data from groups.io API.

data.message:
[gitlab] Add retry on 503 HTTP errors

This code allows the backend to reissue petititions to
the GitLab API in case of 503 HTTP errors. This fix is needed
to avoid the fetching process to be stopped due to upstream
server problems.

data.Author: Valerio Cosentino <valcos@bitergia.com>
data.message:
[github] Handle upstream server connection problems

This code limits the connection problems with the github api. In a
nutshell, the github backend puts now in place retrying mechanisms for
the following http errors 403, 500, 502, 503. Note that this solution
doesn't guarantee to completely solve the connection problems, since
the retry is executed a limited number of times (param `max_retries`),
before raising an exception.

data.Author: Valerio Cosentino <valcos@bitergia.com>
data.message:
[tests] Add test about retry error for GitHub

This code add a test to check whether a retry error is thrown
when the http error in one of the extra_status_forcelist
[403, 500, 502, 503].

data.Author: Valerio Cosentino <valcos@bitergia.com>
data.message:
[git] Allow fetch without update repo

This code allows to fetch the commits of a repo without
performing any update against the target repo. This new
feature is enable by setting the fetch param `no_update`
to true (by default is disabled).

data.Author: Valerio Cosentino <valcos@bitergia.com>
data.message:
[tests] Add tests to check fetch without update

This code includes tests to check that the fetch without
update properly works.

Closes #475

data.Author: Valerio Cosentino <valcos@bitergia.com>
data.message:
[git] Add rev-list command to GitRepository class

This code adds support for the `rev-list` command, thus
the list of commit hashes is retrieved from the repo without
triggering any update. The rev-list is executed with the
following params by default:
`git rev-list --topo-order --branches --tags --remotes=origin`.
However, using the param `branches`, it is possible to
analysis a set of branches.

Tests have been added accordingly.

data.message:

The function adds a new relationship between the unique identity
identified by 'uuid' and the given 'organization'. The given
identity and organization must exist prior to add this enrollment.
The period of the enrollment can be given with the parameters 'start_date'
and 'end_date'.

If the given enrollment data is already in the registry, the function
will raise an exception.

data.Author: Santiago Dueñas <sduenas@bitergia.com>
data.message:
[database] Fix 'Too many connections' error

In SQLAlchemy, when a session is closed using close() method, it
is not really closed. It is sent to a pool of connections. That is
why 'Too many connections' error was raised.

To avoid this, each session has to be deleted from the pool
using NullPool class.

data.message:
[mg2sh] Script to export identities from Metrics Grimoire databases

mg2sh is a script that exports information about identities from
Metrics Girmoire databases (i.e CVSAnalY, Bicho, IRCAnalysis, etc).
The information is exported into a JSON object that follows the
sortinghat identities format.

[api] Support top domains

With 'is_top_domain' flag, a domain can be set as a top domain.
This is useful to avoid the insertion of sub-domains which belong
to the same organization (i.e  eu.example.com, us.example.com).
This flag can be updated using 'overwrite' parameter.

Model and tests were also updated to support this new feature.

email address are valid. To check when an email address is valid
the next pattern is used: "^(?P<email>[^\s@]+@[^\s@.]+\.[^\s@]+)$".

[tests] Fix non-deterministic order on identities lists

For unknown reasons, SQLAlchemy does not return the list
of identities in the same order every time that the tests
are call. For this reason, we sort the list of identities
before checking their values.

[parsing:sh] Encode UUID and ids to UTF-8

integer values. For this reason, these fields are encoded
to avoid common unicode errors.

data.Author: Santiago Dueñas <sduenas@bitergia.com>
data.message:
[api] Check identity id uniqueness in add_identity()

So far, sortinghat did not check whether the id of an identity
was already inserted in the database. It only checked if the
tuple (source, name, email, username) was stored. This might
raise some problems like in #67, when the values of an identity
are truncated because their length, so they were not found in the
database when they are compared.

With this patch this problem will not happen again because
for those cases, the UUID will be the same and a AlreadyExistError
will be raised. If for any reason the UUIDs are different,
it still have a unique constraint in the identities table that
checks if new tuples of (source, name, email, username) to be inserted
already exist in the database.

The problem with the length of the values will persist and
they will be truncated.

data.Author: Santiago Dueñas <sduenas@bitergia.com>
data.message:
[database] Fix TIME_WAIT connections error

For unknown reasons, when an exception is raised when a
database connection is in use, the connection will not close
properly, leaving it in a TIME_WAIT state. If this happens
many times, for example when a huge amount of identities are
affiliated, MySQL servers ignore new incoming connections
util those open are closed by the kernel.

This behaviour only occurs using NullPool class. That class
closes connections, when a session is over. Replacing it by
QueuePool class fixes this issue because it reuses connections.

The use of this class raises the "Too many connections" error
when test cases are run (see 693837f for further info). This
commit also fixes the unit tests reusing the connections.

data.Author: Santiago Dueñas <sduenas@bitergia.com>

data.Author: Santiago Dueñas <sduenas@bitergia.com>
data.message:
[parsing:mozilla] Fix error parsing 'alternate_emails' fields

The field 'alternate_emails' has a different structure to which
was expected. Each email is stored in a dictionary with two
fields ('email' and 'privacy') but the parser did not parse
and extract right the email value.

This patch fixes that problem. Unit tests were added as well.

data.message: [cmd:init] Check invalid database names

data.Author: Santiago Dueñas <sduenas@bitergia.com>
data.message:
[utils] Use case insensitive seed to generate UUIDs

So far, the identities UUIDs are generated using case sensitive
values with the seed (source:email:name:username). This means
that for an identity with the same values in upper or lower case
(i.e: jsmith@example.com and JSMITH@example.com) different UUIDs
are generated when the identity is the same.

This patch fixes this problem generating UUIDs ignoring the case
of the values.

Take into account that it produces an incompatibility with
previous UUIDs. These UUIDs must be regenerated.

data.message: Merge branch 'new-uuids' of 'https://github.com/grimoirelab/sortinghat.git'

data.Author: Santiago Dueñas <sduenas@bitergia.com>
data.message:
[utils] Support unaccent unicode strings in to_unicode()

The option 'unaccent' has been added in to_unicode() function.
This allows to convert accent characters to their unnacent
canonical form. For instance, 'Ê, ê, é, ë' are considered the
same character as 'e' or 'Ĉ, ć' the same as 'c'.

data.Author: Santiago Dueñas <sduenas@bitergia.com>
data.message:
[utils] Use unaccent name values to generate UUIDs

So far, the identities UUIDs are generated using accent characters
This means that for an identity with the same values accent or
unaccent (i.e: John Smith or Jöhn Smith), different UUIDs
are generated when the identity is the same.

This patch fixes this problem generating UUIDs converting this
accent character to their canonical form.

This change is caused by the behaviour of MySQL with unaccent
or accent characters. MySQL considers those characters the same,
raising IntegrityError exceptions when similar tuples with accent
or unaccent values are inserted into the database. Generating
the same UUID for these cases will prevent the error.

Take into account that it produces an incompatibility with
previous UUIDs. These UUIDs must be regenerated.

Adding the 'surrogateescape' handler fixes that problem.

data.Author: Santiago Dueñas <sduenas@bitergia.com>
data.message:
[model] Force 'utf8_unicode_ci' collation on MySQL tables

MySQL considers chars like 'β' and 'b' or 'ı' and 'i' the same,
when some collation values are set (i.e utf8_general_ci). This can
raise integrity errors when Sorting Hat tries to add similar
identities with these pairs of characters.

For instance, if the identity:

    ('scm', 'βart', 'bart@example.com', 'bart)

is stored in the database, the insertion of:

    ('scm', 'bart', 'bart@example.com', 'bart)

will raise an error, even when these identities have different
UUIDs.

Forcing MySQL to use 'utf8_unicode_ci' fixes this error, allowing
to insert both identities.

data.Author: Santiago Dueñas <sduenas@bitergia.com>

error and must be avoided.

This commit fixes this problem setting None as a default
parameter for 'blacklist'.

data.message:
[cmd:export] Remove trailing whitespaces in JSON files

This error is only found in Python 2.7 due to a bug in the
standard library with json.dump() and 'indent' parameter.

The proposed solution works for Python 2.7 and Python 3.x
versions. It forces to use ',' and ': ' as separators in
the JSON file.

More info:
    https://bugs.python.org/issue16333 and
    https://hg.python.org/cpython/rev/78bad589f205

Fixes #103

data.Author: Valerio Cosentino <valcos@bitergia.com>
data.message:
[db] Fix tables created with invalid collation

In some random situations SortingHat tables appear with an invalid
collation. This is related to a wrong generation of the DDL table
statement by SqlAlchemy, which may randomly prepend the collation
information (mysql_collate) to the charset one (mysql_charset),
causing the former to be ignored. Changing mysql_charset to
mysql_default_charset fixes the problem.

data.Author: Jesus M. Gonzalez-Barahona <jgb@gsyc.es>
data.message:
[model][tests] Define an order for domains and adapt tests to MariaDB

In models.py, add an order for domains, so that they are
ordered with respect to organizations.

Adapt testing to these changes.

In addition, adapt to testing using MariaDB as backend.
MariaDB has some peculiarities when using it from SQLAlchemy.
These changes address them. Most of the changes are for the
tests themselves, except for the one to database.py, which
includes a new exception which is raised by MariaDB.
Now, all the tests pass with MariaDB.

This caused some pain for tests with MySQL, because some
stuff was ordered differently now. So, in this patch there
are some minot tweaks to the tests to ensure the order
in some cases is the same for both database (and, at the
same time, to avoid randomness). Now, all tests pass
with MySQL too.

In the process, a bug in utils.merge_date_ranges() was
uncovered, and fixed.

data.Author: Santiago Dueñas <sduenas@bitergia.com>
data.message:
Merge branch 'db_api' of 'https://github.com/sduenas/sortinghat/'

This patch provides a low-level API to execute basic operations
over the database, such as adding or removing identities or
finding entities.

All these operations work within a session. Nothing is stored in
the database until the session is closed. Thus, these functions
can be considered as "bricks", that combined can create high-level
functions.

Merges #147
Closes #147

data.Author: Jesus M. Gonzalez-Barahona <jgb@gsyc.es>
data.message:
[tests] Adapt tests to run with setup.py test

In the migration to get all of GrimoireLab modules to run the
tests via setup.py, some stuff waas needed, which is in this
patch:

* Adaption of setup.py itself, including testing dependencies,
adapting some other details in the script.
* Adaption of tests to be run from the parent directory.
* Create the database to use for testing, and remove it after the
tests.
* New option in tests.conf, for running that code to
create the database or not.
* Adapt the README.md to show how tests are run.
* Adapt .travis.yml to run with setup.py (and update it a bit).

In the process for adapting the tests to be run from the parent
directory, their portability was increased: now they should run
also in systems where "/" is not the path separator.

data.Author: Santiago Dueñas <sduenas@bitergia.com>
data.message:
[database] Use a optimistic approach when inserting data

With this optimistic approach, no more queries to check
whether an entity exists on the database are run prior to
its insertion. The new procedure works as follows:

  * Try to insert an entity without checking whether it exists in
    the database or not.
  * If the entity exists, an IntegrityError or a FlushError will
    be raised.
  * Rollback the transaction
  * Catch this error and check if it is an error raised by a
    duplicate entry.
  * If that was the cause, handle the error and raise an
    `AlreadyExistsError`.

Some changes were needed in `AlreadyExistsError` exception to
store the ID and the type of the duplicated entry.

data.Author: Valerio Cosentino <valcos@bitergia.com>
data.message:
[unify] Add resume method to unify command

This code proposes a method to recover failed unify executions.
In a nutshell, after calculating the matches in memory, they are
converted to JSON items and marked as not processed. Each match
successfully executed is marked as processed. In case of a failure,
the failed match plus the remaining ones are serialized to disk
(which location is fixed). In the next execution, those matches
will be loaded and re-executed again, if the recovery option is
enabled.

data.Author: Santiago Dueñas <sduenas@bitergia.com>
data.message:
[db] Handle disconnection using pessimistic mode

SQLAlchemy offers a pessimistic mode to handle database
disconnection. Setting 'pool_pre_ping' parameter on the
database engine will check if the database connection
is still active when a session of the connection pool
is reused. To check that it runs a simple SQL statement.
This causes a small hit in the performance but it's worth
it.

This feature was included in 1.2 version, so the list
of dependencies has been updated as well.

data.Author: Santiago Dueñas <sduenas@bitergia.com>
data.message:
[db] Support UTF-8 fully in MySQL/MariaDB

The default charset of UTF-8 (utf8) in MySQL/MariaDB does
not support, even when they are part of the standard,
4-bytes long characters. This means characters like emojis
or certain chinese characters cannot be inserted. Usually,
identities names or usernames have these types of characters.

The charset that fully supports UTF-8 is 'utf8mb4' using the
collation 'utf8mb4_unicode_520_ci'. This collation implements
the suggested Unicode Collation Algorithm (v5.2).

Using 'utf8mb4' also implies that the maximum size of char
(VARCHAR and so on) columns is 191. Indexes cannot be larger
than that when using InnoDB engine.

This patch can break the database so it is recommended to
regenerate again the database from a dump.

More info:
  * https://dev.mysql.com/worklog/task/?id=2673
  * https://dev.mysql.com/doc/refman/5.5/en/charset-unicode-conversion.html
  * https://mathiasbynens.be/notes/mysql-utf8mb4

data.Author: Santiago Dueñas <sduenas@bitergia.com>
data.message:
Add flake8 configuration

This configuration sets the maximum line length to 130
characters because some unit tests can have long lines;
excludes some directories from the analysis, such as docs,
build, docker, etc; and ignores the next errors:

  * E129 visually indented line with same indent as next logical line
  * E402 module level import not at top of file
  * F841 local variable '_' is assigned to but never used

data.Author: Santiago Dueñas <sduenas@bitergia.com>
data.message:
[model] Migrate model to Django ORM

The previous Sorting Hat model was based on SQLAlchemy ORM.
This one preserves the same structure but adds two new fields
to each object. These two new fields are 'created_at' and
'last_modified'.

The first field will be set only to the date when an object
is created. The second one will be set automatically when an
object is modified.

Along with this commit, it's been included the migrations file
used by Django to setup the database; the requirements file
with the Python packages needed to run this software and
a directory with unit tests.

data.Author: Santiago Dueñas <sduenas@bitergia.com>
data.message:
[graphql] Define basic GraphQL query to fetch organizations

This commit defines a basic schema and a query to retrieve
the information stored by an organization. To ask for the
list of organizations and their domains stored by SortingHat,
a GraphQL query would be like this:

```
{
  organizations {
    name
    domains {
      domain
      isTopDomain
    }
  }
}
```

GraphQL support is provided by `graphene` and `graphene_django`
libraries. The project configuration has been modified to
set the GraphQL web client for testing purposes. This client
is accessible through '/graphql' URL. In a future, it will be
removed from the standard configuration.

data.Author: Santiago Dueñas <sduenas@bitergia.com>
data.message:
[utils] Support unaccent unicode strings in to_unicode()

he option 'unaccent' has been added in to_unicode() function.
This allows to convert accent characters to their unnacent
canonical form. For instance, 'Ê, ê, é, ë' are considered the
same character as 'e' or 'Ĉ, ć' the same as 'c'.

data.message:
[api] Define function to add identities

The new atomic function add_identity() allows to add new identities
to the registry and assign them to unique identities.
By default, this function also creates a new unique identity
each time that a new identity is added.

data.Author: Santiago Dueñas <sduenas@bitergia.com>
data.message:
[graphql] Define GraphQL mutation to add identities

The mutation 'addIdentity' allows to add a new identity
to the registry. These identities can be added to
an existing unique identity. By defualt, a new unique
identity will be created which each new identity.

Errors are returned in case the identity already exists,
when the unique identity to link the new identity
does not exist or when any parameter has an invalid value.

To add an identity a mutation query like this will work:

mutation addId(
  $source: String,
  $name: String,
  $email: String,
  $username: String
  $uuid: String) {
  addIdentity(
    source: $source
    name: $name
    email: $email
    username: $username
    uuid: $uuid) {
      uuid
      identity {
        id
        name
        email
        username
        source
      }
    }
  }

data.Author: David Moreno <dmorenolumb@gmail.com>
data.message:
[graphql] Allow filtering uidentities by uuid

In order to get one uidentity by its uuid we added a filter to the
query. Moreover, a new type for filtering has been created in
order to add filters easily without changing the query, so we can
filter in more than one field using this new type.

This query expects these three behaviors:

- If you specify the uuid in the filter you will receive the
  uidentites that match that uuid.
- If you don't put the uuid filter, you will receive all the
  uidentites.
- If you put an uuid in the filter that does not exist,
  you will receive an empty list.

There are also tests in order to check that it works as expected.

data.Author: Santiago Dueñas <sduenas@bitergia.com>
data.message:
[database] Fix 'Too many connections' error

In SQLAlchemy, when a session is closed using close() method, it
is not really closed. It is sent to a pool of connections. That is
why 'Too many connections' error was raised.

To avoid this, each session has to be deleted from the pool
using NullPool class.

data.Author: Santiago Dueñas <sduenas@bitergia.com>
data.message:
[mg2sh] Script to export identities from Metrics Grimoire databases

mg2sh is a script that exports information about identities from
Metrics Girmoire databases (i.e CVSAnalY, Bicho, IRCAnalysis, etc).
The information is exported into a JSON object that follows the
sortinghat identities format.

data.Author: Santiago Dueñas <sduenas@bitergia.com>

[cmd:load] Set source of the identities

Using the option --source, the user can set in the registry
where the information comes from.

data.Author: Santiago Dueñas <sduenas@bitergia.com>
data.message:
[cmd:load] Add class to load identities based on distinct formats

'IdentitiesLoader' is an abstract class defined to import identities
based on differnt formats. Some existing code from 'Load' was refactored
into 'EclipseIdentitiesLoader' class to import identities using Eclipse
identities JSON format.

New exception 'LoadError' has been also develop to raise errors when
something goes wrong loading identities.

Subclassing IdentityMatcher will allow to have distinct methods,
heuristics or algorithms to determine when two unique identities
are likely the same.

data.Author: Santiago Dueñas <sduenas@bitergia.com>
data.message:
[matching] Add SimpleMatcher class

This matcher only produces a positive result when two identities
from each unique identity share the same email address. It also
returns a positive match when the uuid on both unique identities
is equal.

Unit tests also added.

data.message:
[api] Support top domains

With 'is_top_domain' flag, a domain can be set as a top domain.
This is useful to avoid the insertion of sub-domains which belong
to the same organization (i.e  eu.example.com, us.example.com).
This flag can be updated using 'overwrite' parameter.

Model and tests were also updated to support this new feature.

the next pattern is used: "^(?P<email>[^\s@]+@[^\s@.]+\.[^\s@]+)$".

data.message:
[tests] Fix non-deterministic order on identities lists

For unknown reasons, SQLAlchemy does not return the list
of identities in the same order every time that the tests
are call. For this reason, we sort the list of identities
before checking their values.

[parsing:sh] Encode UUID and ids to UTF-8

integer values. For this reason, these fields are encoded
to avoid common unicode errors.

data.Author: Santiago Dueñas <sduenas@bitergia.com>
data.message:
[api] Check the existence of a UUID when a new identity is created

So far, add_identity() function only checked whether a tuple of
source, name, email and username existed on the database before
the insertion of a new identity. With this patch, the UUID is also
checked to avoid problems when tuples with the combination of
"None" and None values are inserted.

data.Author: Santiago Dueñas <sduenas@bitergia.com>
data.message:
[api] Check identity id uniqueness in add_identity()

So far, sortinghat did not check whether the id of an identity
was already inserted in the database. It only checked if the
tuple (source, name, email, username) was stored. This might
raise some problems like in #67, when the values of an identity
are truncated because their length, so they were not found in the
database when they are compared.

With this patch this problem will not happen again because
for those cases, the UUID will be the same and a AlreadyExistError
will be raised. If for any reason the UUIDs are different,
it still have a unique constraint in the identities table that
checks if new tuples of (source, name, email, username) to be inserted
already exist in the database.

The problem with the length of the values will persist and
they will be truncated.

data.Author: Santiago Dueñas <sduenas@bitergia.com>
data.message:
[database] Fix TIME_WAIT connections error

For unknown reasons, when an exception is raised when a
database connection is in use, the connection will not close
properly, leaving it in a TIME_WAIT state. If this happens
many times, for example when a huge amount of identities are
affiliated, MySQL servers ignore new incoming connections
util those open are closed by the kernel.

This behaviour only occurs using NullPool class. That class
closes connections, when a session is over. Replacing it by
QueuePool class fixes this issue because it reuses connections.

The use of this class raises the "Too many connections" error
when test cases are run (see 693837f for further info). This
commit also fixes the unit tests reusing the connections.

data.Author: Santiago Dueñas <sduenas@bitergia.com>
data.message:
[utils] Use case insensitive seed to generate UUIDs

So far, the identities UUIDs are generated using case sensitive
values with the seed (source:email:name:username). This means
that for an identity with the same values in upper or lower case
(i.e: jsmith@example.com and JSMITH@example.com) different UUIDs
are generated when the identity is the same.

This patch fixes this problem generating UUIDs ignoring the case
of the values.

Take into account that it produces an incompatibility with
previous UUIDs. These UUIDs must be regenerated.

data.Author: Santiago Dueñas <sduenas@bitergia.com>
data.message:
[utils] Support unaccent unicode strings in to_unicode()

The option 'unaccent' has been added in to_unicode() function.
This allows to convert accent characters to their unnacent
canonical form. For instance, 'Ê, ê, é, ë' are considered the
same character as 'e' or 'Ĉ, ć' the same as 'c'.

data.Author: Santiago Dueñas <sduenas@bitergia.com>
data.message:
[utils] Use unaccent name values to generate UUIDs

So far, the identities UUIDs are generated using accent characters
This means that for an identity with the same values accent or
unaccent (i.e: John Smith or Jöhn Smith), different UUIDs
are generated when the identity is the same.

This patch fixes this problem generating UUIDs converting this
accent character to their canonical form.

This change is caused by the behaviour of MySQL with unaccent
or accent characters. MySQL considers those characters the same,
raising IntegrityError exceptions when similar tuples with accent
or unaccent values are inserted into the database. Generating
the same UUID for these cases will prevent the error.

Take into account that it produces an incompatibility with
previous UUIDs. These UUIDs must be regenerated.

Version updated to 0.3.1.dev1.

data.Author: Santiago Dueñas <sduenas@bitergia.com>
data.message:
[model] Force 'utf8_unicode_ci' collation on MySQL tables

MySQL considers chars like 'β' and 'b' or 'ı' and 'i' the same,
when some collation values are set (i.e utf8_general_ci). This can
raise integrity errors when Sorting Hat tries to add similar
identities with these pairs of characters.

For instance, if the identity:

    ('scm', 'βart', 'bart@example.com', 'bart)

is stored in the database, the insertion of:

    ('scm', 'bart', 'bart@example.com', 'bart)

will raise an error, even when these identities have different
UUIDs.

Forcing MySQL to use 'utf8_unicode_ci' fixes this error, allowing
to insert both identities.

data.Author: Santiago Dueñas <sduenas@bitergia.com>
data.message:
[matching] Fix error setting an empty list as default to blacklist

The declaration of the __init__ method, assigns an empty list
to 'blacklist' as the default paramameter. This is a common
error and must be avoided.

This commit fixes this problem setting None as a default
parameter for 'blacklist'.

data.Author: Santiago Dueñas <sduenas@bitergia.com>
data.message:
[matching] Support sources filtering on matchers

With this feature, only those identities which their sources
are included on the given list will be used during the
matching process.

data.Author: Santiago Dueñas <sduenas@bitergia.com>
data.message:
[cmd:export] Remove trailing whitespaces in JSON files

This error is only found in Python 2.7 due to a bug in the
standard library with json.dump() and 'indent' parameter.

The proposed solution works for Python 2.7 and Python 3.x
versions. It forces to use ',' and ': ' as separators in
the JSON file.

More info:
    https://bugs.python.org/issue16333 and
    https://hg.python.org/cpython/rev/78bad589f205

Fixes #103

data.message:
[model] Coerce boolean type

This patch restricts the accepted values for booleans to True, False
0 and 1 using a sqlalchemy typedecorator. This fix is equivalent to
adding check constraints on boolean DB columns, however this kind
of constraint is ignored in MySQL DBs.

data.Author: Valerio Cosentino <valcos@bitergia.com>
data.message:
[db] Fix tables created with invalid collation

In some random situations SortingHat tables appear with an invalid
collation. This is related to a wrong generation of the DDL table
statement by SqlAlchemy, which may randomly prepend the collation
information (mysql_collate) to the charset one (mysql_charset),
causing the former to be ignored. Changing mysql_charset to
mysql_default_charset fixes the problem.

data.Author: Jesus M. Gonzalez-Barahona <jgb@gsyc.es>
data.message:
[model][tests] Define an order for domains and adapt tests to MariaDB

In models.py, add an order for domains, so that they are
ordered with respect to organizations.

Adapt testing to these changes.

In addition, adapt to testing using MariaDB as backend.
MariaDB has some peculiarities when using it from SQLAlchemy.
These changes address them. Most of the changes are for the
tests themselves, except for the one to database.py, which
includes a new exception which is raised by MariaDB.
Now, all the tests pass with MariaDB.

This caused some pain for tests with MySQL, because some
stuff was ordered differently now. So, in this patch there
are some minot tweaks to the tests to ensure the order
in some cases is the same for both database (and, at the
same time, to avoid randomness). Now, all tests pass
with MySQL too.

In the process, a bug in utils.merge_date_ranges() was
uncovered, and fixed.

data.Author: Jesus M. Gonzalez-Barahona <jgb@gsyc.es>
data.message:
[tests] Create tests database before running tests.

I got a bit fed up of having to create the database for tests
before actually running the tests. And anyway, for automation
it is nice that you just "run_tests.py". So, I instrumented
the base class for all database tests, so that it creates
(only once in a test run) the database before running all the
tests.

Since now it is not needed, I also removed the dabase creation
line from the travis config.

data.Author: Jesus M. Gonzalez-Barahona <jgb@gsyc.es>
data.message:
[init] Remove annoying error.

This line caused an error message to show up, in case when no
error was really happening (just the database was initialized).
That caused users to think something was wrong.

data.Author: Jesus M. Gonzalez-Barahona <jgb@gsyc.es>
data.message:
[autoprofile] Avoid exception when no id in selected data sources

Fixes #122

In some cases, a uuid has only ids for data sources which are not
among those selected for autoprofiling. In this case, it may happen
that one of those uuids is selected for autoprofiling, and no
id is going to be found (because only those corresponding to
the selected data sources are considered). This patch catches
the exception that is raised in that case.

A better fix is described in #122.

data.message:
[db:api] Add common functions to look for identities

This patch adds two functions to look for UniqueIdentity
and Identity objects: find_unique_identity() and find_identity().
So far, the same code used to search these objects could
be found repeated along the code.

data.Author: Santiago Dueñas <sduenas@bitergia.com>
data.message:
[db:api] Add common functions to look for organizations

This patch adds two functions to look for Organization and
Domain objects: find_organization() and find_domain().
So far, the same code used to search these objects could
be found repeated along the code.

data.Author: Santiago Dueñas <sduenas@bitergia.com>
data.message:
[db:api] Add function to add unique identities

The function add_unique_identity() allows to create
and add a new UniqueIdentity object to a given
session.

data.Author: Santiago Dueñas <sduenas@bitergia.com>
data.message:
[db:api] Add function to add identities

The function add_identity() allows to create and to add
a new Identity object to a given session.

data.Author: Santiago Dueñas <sduenas@bitergia.com>
data.message:
[db:api] Add function to add organizations

The function add_organization() allows to create and to add
a new Organization object to a given session.

data.Author: Santiago Dueñas <sduenas@bitergia.com>
data.message:
[db:api] Add function to add domains

The function add_domain() allows to create and to add
a new Domain object to a given session and link it
to an Organization object.

data.Author: Santiago Dueñas <sduenas@bitergia.com>
data.message:
[db:api] Add function to enroll unique identities

The new function enroll() allows to create and
to add a new Enrollment object to a given session,
linking it to a UniqueIdentity and to an Organization.

data.Author: Santiago Dueñas <sduenas@bitergia.com>
data.message:
[db:api] Add function to look for contries

This commit adds a find_country() function to look for
Contry objects.

data.Author: Santiago Dueñas <sduenas@bitergia.com>
data.message:
[db:api] Add function for editing profiles

The funtion edit_profile() allows to edit or update
the profile of a UniqueIdentity object.

data.Author: Santiago Dueñas <sduenas@bitergia.com>
data.message:
[db:api] Add function to move identities

Identities  can be moved to UniqueIdentity objects
using move_identity() function.

data.Author: Santiago Dueñas <sduenas@bitergia.com>
data.message:
[db:api] Add function to remove unique identities

The function delete_unique_identity() removes a
UniqueIdentity and its related objects from the
database.

data.Author: Santiago Dueñas <sduenas@bitergia.com>
data.message:
[db:api] Add function to remove identities

The function delete_identity() removes an Identity
from the database.

data.Author: Santiago Dueñas <sduenas@bitergia.com>
data.message:
[db:api] Add function to remove organizations

The function delete_organization() removes an Organization
and its related objects from the  database.

data.Author: Santiago Dueñas <sduenas@bitergia.com>
data.message:
[db:api] Add function to remove domains

The function delete_domain() removes a Domain
from the database.

data.Author: Santiago Dueñas <sduenas@bitergia.com>
data.message:
[db:api] Add function to withdraw unique identities

The function withdraw() removes from the database
all the Enrollment objects linked to a UniqueIdentity
and to an Organization.

data.Author: Santiago Dueñas <sduenas@bitergia.com>
data.message:
[db:api] Call flush() when deleting objects

This will prevent for raising integrity exceptions
when an object is added and has the same values than
other, which has been deleted within the same session.

data.Author: Santiago Dueñas <sduenas@bitergia.com>
data.message:
[db:api] Add function to move enrollments

The function move_enrollment() allows to move an
Enrollment objects between unique identities.

data.Author: Santiago Dueñas <sduenas@bitergia.com>
data.message:
[db:api] Add function to delete enrollments

The function delete_enrollment() removes an Enrollment
object from the database.

data.Author: Santiago Dueñas <sduenas@bitergia.com>
data.message:
[exceptions] Rename WrappedValueError to InvalidValueError

InvalidValueError is a better name for this exception.
Additionally, any ValueError raised by DB API functions
will be raised as InvalidValueError.

data.Author: Santiago Dueñas <sduenas@bitergia.com>
data.message: [api] Improve output messages for enrollment commands

data.Author: Santiago Dueñas <sduenas@bitergia.com>
data.message:
[db:api] Add function to add entries to the blacklist

With add_to_matching_blacklist() function terms can
be blacklisted for later usage during matching
operations.

data.Author: Santiago Dueñas <sduenas@bitergia.com>
data.message:
[db:api] Add function to remove entries to the blacklist

The function delete_from_matching_blacklist() removes
a MatchingBlacklist object from the database.

data.Author: Santiago Dueñas <sduenas@bitergia.com>
data.message:
Merge branch 'db_api' of 'https://github.com/sduenas/sortinghat/'

This patch provides a low-level API to execute basic operations
over the database, such as adding or removing identities or
finding entities.

All these operations work within a session. Nothing is stored in
the database until the session is closed. Thus, these functions
can be considered as "bricks", that combined can create high-level
functions.

Merges #147
Closes #147

data.Author: Valerio Cosentino <valcos@bitergia.com>
data.message:
[all] Remove support for Python 2.7

This code removes support for Python 2.7 from sortinghat. Thus,
misc, bin, sortinghat and tests folders plus the travis.yml are
modified accordingly.

data.Author: Valerio Cosentino <valcos@bitergia.com>
data.message:
[sortinghat] Fix flake8 errors

This code fixes several flake8 errors to make the code compatible
with PEP8 standard. Thus, the folders tests, bin, sortinghat, misc
are modified accordingly.

data.Author: Santiago Dueñas <sduenas@bitergia.com>

Merges #150

data.Author: Jesus M. Gonzalez-Barahona <jgb@gsyc.es>
data.message:
[tests] Adapt tests to run with setup.py test

In the migration to get all of GrimoireLab modules to run the
tests via setup.py, some stuff waas needed, which is in this
patch:

* Adaption of setup.py itself, including testing dependencies,
adapting some other details in the script.
* Adaption of tests to be run from the parent directory.
* Create the database to use for testing, and remove it after the
tests.
* New option in tests.conf, for running that code to
create the database or not.
* Adapt the README.md to show how tests are run.
* Adapt .travis.yml to run with setup.py (and update it a bit).

In the process for adapting the tests to be run from the parent
directory, their portability was increased: now they should run
also in systems where "/" is not the path separator.
